header.title: What is GICTrade?
header.content: GICTrade is P2P forex trading platform while people can choose between traders or market makers.

item1.content: Trader is an individual who engages in the buying and selling of financial assets in any financial market, either for himself or on behalf of another person

item2.content: Market maker is a dealer in securities or other assets who undertakes to buy or sell at specified prices at all times.

header.title: - The Peer to Peer Forex and Commodity Platform You Can Trust
header.content: Forex Trading is the largest financial market in the world amounting to more than $6.6 trillion dollars daily turnover in 2019, but despite of this, Forex trading image is not good and there are wide assumptions that Brokers are dishonest and Forex Trading considered as “scam”. After going through the Forex Trading ecosystem, we identified several big problems in Forex Trading with no solutions (yet!)

header2.title: The Biggest Problem in the Forex Trading Industry!
header2.content: Forex trading operates like a casino with a lot of conflict of interest!
header2.item1: 1. The more you trade, the more the brokers are making money
header2.item2: 2. Traders and Market Makers are always in opposite direction meaning when Traders profit, Market Makers lose money and vice versa!

game-changer.title: The Game Changer
game-changer.content: GIC believes there is a better trading arena for both Traders and Market Makers and we set out to build just that - a blockchain based Peer to Peer Forex and Commodity Trading Platform with no conflict of interest, minimum fees, better transparency and access to Market Maker function

item1.title: Fees
item1.content: High trading fees are the second biggest problem that traders faced. The higher the trading fees, the more difficult traders will be able to break even and profit

item2.title: No Transparancy
item2.content: With all the trading activities being recorded on centralized server, there is lack of transparancy, hence trust

item3.title: No Access to Market Maker Function
item3.content: With all the trading activities occur on the ‘other’ side server, there is lack of transparancy, hence trust

the-benefit.title: The Benefit
the-benefit.content: With the breakthrough Peer to Peer technology, All GIC customers are able to choose to become Traders or/and Market makers seamlessly, therefore we are also able to cut intermediaries and reduce cost, that will benefit traders in the platform
the-benefit.item2: 2. Free Swap with no minimum deposit
the-benefit.item3: 3. Lowest spread Access to Market Maker function for retailer with a minimum equity of $5000
the-benefit.item4: 4. With both Traders and Market Makers consisted of customers instead of institution. There is no more conflict of interest problem

item1.content: Earn extra money from followers who follow your trades. Promote, get new Followers, and get your benefits as master!

item2.content: Choose your master in GICSocial Trade. Pick copytrade to follow their trading action without spending a lot of time creating your own strategies.

header.title: Privacy Policy
header.content: Global Investa Capital (GIC) collects some Personal Data from its Users.

item1.title: a). Owner and data controller
item1.content: PT. Global Investa Capital – Centennial Tower Level 29, Jalan Jenderal Gatot Subroto No. 27, Karet Semanggi, Kecamatan Setiabudi, Kota Jakarta Selatan, Daerah Khusus Ibukota Jakarta, 12950 Owner contact email: support@gictrade.io

item2.title: b). Types of data collected
item2.content:
Among the types of Personal Data that GIC collects, by itself or through third parties, there are: Cookies; Usage Data; email address; first name; last name; phone number; address; gender; date of birth; country; ZIP/Postal code.
Complete details on each type of Personal Data collected are provided in the dedicated sections of this privacy policy or by specific explanation texts displayed prior to the Data collection.
Personal Data may be freely provided by the User, or, in case of Usage Data, collected automatically when using GIC. Unless specified otherwise, all Data requested by GIC is mandatory and failure to provide this Data may make it impossible for GIC to provide its services. In cases where GIC specifically states that some Data is not mandatory, Users are free not to communicate this Data without consequences to the availability or the functioning of the Service.
Users who are uncertain about which Personal Data is mandatory are welcome to contact the Owner. Any use of Cookies - or of other tracking tools - by GIC or by the owners of third-party services used by GIC serves the purpose of providing the Service required by the User, in addition to any other purposes described in the present document and in the Cookie Policy, if available. Users are responsible for any third-party Personal Data obtained, published or shared through GIC and confirm that they have the third party's consent to provide the Data to the Owner.

item3.title: c). Mode and place of processing the data
item3.content:
Methods of processing
The Owner takes appropriate security measures to prevent unauthorized access, disclosure, modification, or unauthorized destruction of the Data. The Data processing is carried out using computers and/or IT enabled tools, following organizational procedures and modes strictly related to the purposes indicated. In addition to the Owner, in some cases, the Data may be accessible to certain types of persons in charge, involved with the operation of GIC (administration, sales, marketing, legal, system administration) or external parties (such as third-party technical service providers, mail carriers, hosting providers, IT companies, communications agencies) appointed, if necessary, as Data Processors by the Owner. The updated list of these parties may be requested from the Owner at any time.

Place
The Data is processed at the Owner's operating offices and in any other places where the parties involved in the processing are located. Depending on the User's location, data transfers may involve transferring the User's Data to a country other than their own. To find out more about the place of processing of such transferred Data, Users can check the section containing details about the processing of Personal Data. If any such transfer takes place, Users can find out more by checking the relevant sections of this document or inquire with the Owner using the information provided in the contact section.

Storage Time
Data is stored for the time necessary to provide the services requested by the User, or for the purposes described in this document. Users may request the Data Controller to suspend or delete such data at any time.

item4.title: d). Penggunaan Data yang dikumpulkan
item4.content: The Data concerning the User is collected to allow the Owner to provide its Services, as well as for the following purposes: Analytics, Tag Management, Interaction with live chat platforms, Remarketing and behavioral targeting, Contacting the User, Managing contacts and sending messages and Handling payments. Users can find further detailed information about such purposes of processing and about the specific Personal Data used for each purpose in the respective sections of this document.

item5.title: e). Detailed information on the processing of personal data
item5.content:
Personal Data is collected for the following purposes and using the following services:

Analytics
The services contained in this section enable the Owner to monitor and analyze web traffic and can be used to keep track of User behavior.
Google Ads conversion tracking (Google Inc.)
Google Ads conversion tracking is an analytics service provided by Google LLC or by Google Ireland Limited, depending on the location GIC is accessed from, that connects data from the Google Ads advertising network with actions performed on GIC. Personal Data collected: Cookies; Usage Data. Place of processing: US - Privacy Policy. Privacy Shield participant.

Google Analytics (Google Inc.)
Google Analytics is a web analysis service provided by Google Inc. (“Google”). Google utilizes the Data collected to track and examine the use of GIC, to prepare reports on its activities and share them with other Google services. Google may use the Data collected to contextualize and personalize the ads of its own advertising network. Personal Data collected: Cookies; Usage Data. Place of processing: US - Privacy Policy - Opt Out.

Facebook Ads conversion tracking (Facebook pixel) (Facebook, Inc.)
Facebook Ads conversion tracking (Facebook pixel) is an analytics service provided by Facebook, Inc. that connects data from the Facebook advertising network with actions performed on GIC. The Facebook pixel tracks conversions that can be attributed to ads on Facebook, Instagram and Audience Network. Personal Data collected: Cookies; Usage Data. Place of processing: US - Privacy Policy. Privacy Shield participant.

Display Advertising extension for Google Analytics (Google Inc.)
Google Analytics on GIC might use Google's Interest-based advertising, 3rd-party audience data and information from the Doubleclick Cookie to extend analytics with demographics, interests and ads interaction data. Personal Data collected: Cookies; Usage Data. Place of processing: US - Privacy Policy - Opt Out.

Contacting the User
Mailing List or Newsletter (GIC)
By registering on the mailing list or for the newsletter, the User’s email address will be added to the contact list of those who may receive email messages containing information of commercial or promotional nature concerning GIC. Your email address might also be added to this list as a result of signing up to GIC or after making a purchase. Personal Data collected: address; email address; first name; last name; phone number.

Contact form (GIC)
By filling in the contact form with their Data, the User authorizes GIC to use these details to reply to requests for information, quotes or any other kind of request as indicated by the form’s header. Personal Data collected: address; country; date of birth; email address; first name; gender; last name; phone number; ZIP/Postal code.

Handling payments
Payment processing services enable GIC to process payments by credit card, bank transfer or other means made via any bank registered in Indonesia. To ensure greater security, GIC shares only the information necessary to execute the transaction with the financial intermediaries handling the transaction. Some of these services may also enable the sending of timed messages to the User, such as emails containing invoices or notifications concerning the payment.

Interaction with live chat platforms
This type of services allows Users to interact with third party live chat platforms directly from the pages of GIC, for contacting and being contacted by GIC support service. If one of these services is installed, it may collect browsing and Usage Data in the pages where it is installed, even if the Users do not actively use the service. Moreover, live chat conversations may be logged.

Zopim Widget (Zopim Technologies Pte Ltd)
The Zopim Widget is a service for interacting with the Zopim live chat platform provided by Zopim Technologies Pte Ltd. Personal Data collected: Cookies; Usage Data. Place of processing: Singapore - Privacy Policy.

Managing contacts and sending messages
This type of service makes it possible to manage a database of email contacts, phone contacts or any other contact information to communicate with the User. These services may also collect data concerning the date and time when the message was viewed by the User, as well as when the User interacted with it, such as by clicking on links included in the message.

Mandrill (The Rocket Science Group, LLC.)
Mandrill is an email address management and message sending service provided by The Rocket Science Group, LLC. Personal Data collected: email address; Usage Data. Place of processing: US - Privacy Policy.

Mailchimp (The Rocket Science Group, LLC.)
Mailchimp is an email address management and message sending service provided by The Rocket Science Group LLC. Personal Data collected: email address Place of processing: US - Privacy Policy. Privacy Shield participant.

Mailgun (Mailgun Technologies, Inc.)
Mailgun is an email address management and message sending service provided by The Mailgun Technologies, Inc. Personal Data collected: email address; Usage Data. Place of processing: US - Privacy Policy.

Remarketing and behavioral targeting
This type of service allows GIC and its partners to inform, optimize and serve advertising based on past use of GIC by the User. This activity is performed by tracking Usage Data and by using Cookies, information that is transferred to the partners that manage the remarketing and behavioral targeting activity. In addition to any opt out offered by any of the services below, the User may opt out of a third-party service's use of cookies by visiting the Network Advertising Initiative opt-out page.

Remarketing with Google Analytics (Google Inc.)
Remarketing with Google Analytics is a remarketing and behavioral targeting service provided by Google LLC or by Google Ireland Limited, depending on the location GIC is accessed from, that connects the tracking activity performed by Google Analytics and its Cookies with the Google Ads advertising network and the Doubleclick Cookie. Personal Data collected: Cookies; Usage Data. Place of processing: US - Privacy Policy - Opt Out. Privacy Shield participant.

Facebook Remarketing (Facebook, Inc.)
Facebook Remarketing is a Remarketing and Behavioral Targeting service provided by Facebook, Inc. that connects the activity of GIC with the Facebook advertising network. Personal Data collected: Cookies; Usage Data. Place of processing: US - Privacy Policy - Opt Out.

Twitter Remarketing (Twitter, Inc.)
Twitter Remarketing is a Remarketing and Behavioral Targeting service provided by Twitter, Inc. that connects the activity of GIC with the Twitter advertising network. Personal Data collected: Cookies; Usage Data. Place of processing: US - Privacy Policy - Opt Out. Facebook Custom Audience (Facebook, Inc.) Facebook Custom Audience is a Remarketing and Behavioral Targeting service provided by Facebook, Inc. that connects the activity of GIC with the Facebook advertising network. Personal Data collected: Cookies; email address. Place of processing: US - Privacy Policy - Opt Out. Twitter Tailored Audiences (Twitter, Inc.) Twitter Tailored Audiences is a Remarketing and Behavioral Targeting service provided by Twitter, Inc. that connects the activity of GIC with the Twitter advertising network. Personal Data collected: Cookies; email address. Place of processing: US - Privacy Policy - Opt Out.

Google Ads Remarketing (Google Inc.)
Google Ads Remarketing is a remarketing and behavioral targeting service provided by Google LLC or by Google Ireland Limited, depending on the location GIC is accessed from, that connects the activity of GIC with the Google Ads advertising network and the DoubleClick Cookie. Users can opt out of Google's use of cookies for ads personalization by visiting Google's Ads Settings. Personal Data collected: Cookies; Usage Data. Place of processing: US - Privacy Policy - Opt Out. Privacy Shield participant.
Tag Management
This type of service helps the Owner to manage the tags or scripts needed on GIC in a centralized fashion. This results in the Users' Data flowing through these services, potentially resulting in the retention of this Data.

Google Tag Manager (Google Inc.)
Google Tag Manager is a tag management service provided by Google LLC or by Google Ireland Limited, depending on the location GIC is accessed from. Personal Data collected: Usage Data. Place of processing: US - Privacy Policy. Privacy Shield participant.

item6.title: f). Further information about personal data
item6.content:
• Marketing Communications
Official GIC marketing communication channels: Client Terminal internal mail Mobile push notifications Web push notifications Instant Messenger (Viber, Telegram, Facebook Messenger, WhatsApp etc.)

• TLS data security/encryption
GIC uses Transport Layer Security (TLS) encryption (also known as HTTPS) for all transmitted data. All the data is sent over an encrypted TLS 1.2 connection. In no case card(s) data are saved nor stored within the infrastructure of GIC

item7.title: g). Additional information about data collection and processing
item7.content:
Legal action
The User's Personal Data may be used for legal purposes by the Owner in Court or in the stages leading to possible legal action arising from improper use of GIC or the related Services. The User declares to be aware that the Owner may be required to reveal personal data upon request of public authorities.

Additional information about User's Personal Data
In addition to the information contained in this privacy policy, GIC may provide the User with additional and contextual information concerning particular Services or the collection and processing of Personal Data upon request.

System logs and maintenance
For operation and maintenance purposes, GIC and any third-party Services may collect files that record interaction with GIC (System logs) use other Personal Data (such as the IP Address) for this purpose. Information not contained in this policy More details concerning the collection or processing of Personal Data may be requested from the Owner at any time. Please see the contact information at the beginning of this document.

How “Do Not Track” requests are handled
GIC does not support “Do Not Track” requests. To determine whether any of the third-party services it uses honor the “Do Not Track” requests, please read their privacy policies.

Changes to this privacy policy
The Owner reserves the right to make changes to this privacy policy at any time by giving notice to its Users on this page and possibly within GIC and/or - as far as technically and legally feasible - sending a notice to Users via any contact information available to the Owner. It is strongly recommended to check this page often, referring to the date of the last modification listed at the bottom. Should the changes affect processing activities performed on the basis of the User’s consent, the Owner shall collect new consent from the User, where required.

Definitions and legal references
Personal Data (or Data)
Any information that directly, indirectly, or in connection with other information — including a personal identification number — allows for the identification or identifiability of a natural person.

Usage Data
Information collected automatically through GIC (or third-party services employed in GIC), which can include: the IP addresses or domain names of the computers utilized by the Users who use GIC, the URI addresses (Uniform Resource Identifier), the time of the request, the method utilized to submit the request to the server, the size of the file received in response, the numerical code indicating the status of the server's answer (successful outcome, error, etc.), the country of origin, the features of the browser and the operating system utilized by the User, the various time details per visit (e.g., the time spent on each page within the Application) and the details about the path followed within the Application with special reference to the sequence of pages visited, and other parameters about the device operating system and/or the User's IT environment.

User
The individual using GIC who, unless otherwise specified, coincides with the Data Subject.

Data Subject
The natural person to whom the Personal Data refers.

Data Processor (or Data Supervisor)
The natural or legal person, public authority, agency or another body which processes Personal Data on behalf of the Controller, as described in this privacy policy.

Data Controller (or Owner)
The natural or legal person, public authority, agency or another body which, alone or jointly with others, determines the purposes and means of the processing of Personal Data, including the security measures concerning the operation and use of GIC. The Data Controller, unless otherwise specified, is the Owner of GIC.

GIC (or this Application)
The means by which the Personal Data of the User is collected and processed.

Service
The service provided by GIC as described in the relative terms (if available) and on this site/application.

Cookies
Small piece of data stored in the User's device.

Legal Information
This privacy statement has been prepared based on provisions of multiple legislations. This privacy policy relates solely to GIC, if not stated otherwise within this document.

header.title: Career Opportunity With Us
header.content: Be a part of Global Investa Capital. We provide a career opportunity that supports you to make a real contribution. See how your expertise can make a difference in our company. Find the position you need here.

item1.title: What is GIC?
item1.content: GICTrade is the world’s first Peer to Peer (P2P) Forex Trading Platform that allows investors to choose to be a Trader or a Market Maker. The GICTrade platform uses Metatrader 5 and Blockchain technology to produce safe and transparent trading for all users.

item2.title: Why is GIC Started to be A New Breakthrough?
item2.content:
GICTrade is the first Forex trading platform that gives access to the investors to become Traders or Market Makers, in other words, investors as buyers will meet investors directly as sellers (Peer to Peer). With this concept, certainly, GICTrade becomes a platform at a very different level from common brokers:

  1. Fair and impartial to anyone since the Trader and the Market Maker are equal investors.
  2. By bringing together investors to other investors without passing through an institution or marketing broker, the trading costs on GICTrade reach the minimum rate: no commission, free swap, and low spread.

item3.title: What are The Pre-eminence of GIC compared to Other Brokers?
item3.content:
GICTrade is a P2P Trading Platform, not a broker. GICTrade cooperates with licensed brokers and traders in Indonesia in recording and recapping investors’ trades on GICTrade.
Once again, the P2P concept (investors meet investors directly) is very powerful and opens up many benefits for customers including:
  • Increase the trust of investors who trade on the GICTrade platform since GICTrade is impartial to those who are equal investors.
  • GICTrade trading ecosystem that is P2P without passing through institutions gives ‘Zero Swap Charges’ advantage.
  • Zero Commissions - GIC is benefited from network effects, which means no commission fees.
  • Low Spread - With the P2P concept, GICTrade can provide very competitive and low spreads.
  • Trading Security and Transparency - Blockchain technology strengthens technology security and also peer to peer which prioritizes transaction transparency, enables users to trade confidently.

Besides, trading in GIC is safer, because GIC cooperates with legal brokers and traders, and has a legal license in Indonesia for recapping all transactions to the Jakarta Futures Exchange (BBJ) and the Indonesian Futures Clearing (KBI) under the BAPPEBTI supervision.

item4.title: Is GIC Legal?
item4.content: GIC is a legal forex trading platform founded in Singapore. GIC has received an official legal statement from the Singapore Law Firm RHTLawTaylorWessing LLP in terms of GICT tokens disbursement. Indeed, in Indonesia GIC with the Global InvestaCakrawala business entity cooperates with legal Brokers and Traders under the supervision of BBJ, KBI, and BAPPEBTI. <br/ > Registration number: Capital MegahMandiri: 733 / BAPPEBTI / SP / 6 / 2005 TrijayaPratama Futures: 407 / BAPPEBTI / SI / VII /2004.

item5.title: Is My Deposit safe?
item5.content:
It is safe. It is because GICTrade cooperates with PT. Trijaya Pratama Futures as an official broker that reports all transactions to the Bursa Berjangka Jakarta (BBJ)/ Jakarta Futures Exchange (JFX), then all customer funds are deposited into the PT Trijaya Pratama Futures.
A Segregated Account means a separate account that is watched by an Indonesian government agency.

item6.title: What is Market Maker?
item6.content:
Market Maker is also called a Liquidity Provider (LP) or Trader company is traditionally an institution that functions as a liquidity provider and completes the transactions from traders.
Let us take a look at the example below to make it more understandable:

Trader A makes a buy XUL (gold) transaction at the price of 1500. A transaction can occur if two parties agree to trade at that price. Therefore, trader A does a XUL transaction at the price 1500, who sell at that price? The answer is the Market Maker.

Therefore, it is clear that a Trader opens a buy position, then Market Maker will open a sell position. Traders and Market Makers are always in opposite positions. If the Trader profits, then Market Maker loses as well as if the Trader loses, then Market Maker profits.

To become a Trader company, Indonesia has several requirements as follows:
- Requires expensive license
- Requires a 35 billion fund deposit
- Requires the expensive human resources recruitment
- Requires a representative office (expensive operational costs)

Well, how can investors choose to become Market Maker at GICTrade and how much does it cost to become a Market Maker?
With the technology available on the GICTrade platform, investors can function as Market Makers. Here’s how it works:
You can assume there are 4 investors as Market Maker with the same amount of funds.

item7.title: What are The Advantages of Being a Market Maker?
item7.content:
Let us recap what we have already known about Market Maker:
  1. It needs a lot of money and permission to become a Trader/Market Maker company.
  2. The position is opposite to the trader. When the Traders Profit, the Market Maker Loss, and vice versa. If you choose to become a Market Maker on the GICTrade platform, what are the benefits you get?
  • Market Marker is in a passive manner because Market Maker will take a position when there is a Trader opens a position (Trading passively).
  • Since it is passive, the investors do not need to keep eyes on the charts, no need to allocate special moment for trading.
  • To become a Market Maker investor, you only need a minimum deposit of 5,000 GICT to enjoy the functions of a merchant company without taking care of permits and spending large funds to be deposited to the government.
  • Investors only need to pay a Market Maker fee of 20% of profit without paying a fee to open an office or recruit members and pay for high operational costs (If no profit, no need to pay a fee).

item8.title: What are The Advantages of Being an Active Trader at GIC?
item8.content:
What Are The Advantages of Being An Active Trader at GIC?
Traders at GIC have many advantages as follows:
  1. Fair P2P trading atmosphere
  2. Inexpensive capital starting from 2 million
  3. Low transaction costs, which:
  • Zero Commission: GIC is benefited from network effects, which means no commission fees needed.
  • Zero Swap: All trader’s positions will be directed to meet Market Makers via P2P, so swap costs can be eliminated.
  • To become a Market Maker investor, you only need a minimum deposit of 5,000 GICT to enjoy the functions of a merchant company without taking care of permits and spending large funds to be deposited to the government.
  • Low Spread: The Market Maker function plays an important role as an instant liquidity provider, reduces spreads, and slippage trading. Our P2P market allows the spread of 0 pip in cases.

item9.title: How to make a Deposit?
item9.content: The initial deposit for registering a new trading account on the exchange will use a separate account/Segregated Account of PT. Trijaya Pratama Futures 035-3119670 through BCA Bank.

item10.title: How much is the minimum Deposit?
item10.content: The minimum deposit for Trader is 150 GICT or worth 2 million rupiahs (following the prevailing exchange rate at Primadax). Market Maker is 5000 GICT or worth 75 million rupiahs (following the exchange rate prevailing at Primadax). per 1 GICToken Floating can be checked at Primadax.

item11.title: How many minimum Lots to Trade on GIC?
item11.content: For the traders at GIC, trading can be started from 0.1 lots according to the products of the Bursa Berjangka Jakarta (BBJ)/Jakarta Futures Exchange (JFX) for all Pairs available today.

item12.title: What products can be Traded on GIC?
item12.content:
Trading items available at GIC are currencies, commodities (gold and oil), and INDEX shares (Nikkei and Hanseng)
And for the GICTrade products are:
  • GIC Trade: Blockchain-based Forex Trading Platform (MT5) for traders and market makers.
  • GIC Token: Special Utility Token and it is only for use on the GICTrade platform.
  • GIC Exchange: This exchange platform is used to buy and sell GIC tokens and also disburse fiat into Rupiah.

item13.title: Does GIC provide training for beginner Traders like me?
item13.content: GIC provides a demo account facility that is given to every GIC member who has registered. There is also the GIC Telegram group t.me/GICTrade. GIC also holds regular meetings to discuss how to trade.

item14.title: What is GICT and why should Trading on GIC use GICT?
item14.content: The GICT or GIC token is a utility token that is used to transact through the GIC platform so that investors can enjoy the features provided on the GIC platform.

item15.title: How do I buy GICT?
item15.content:
1. Access the Primadax Trading Platform. You can access through the user’s portal or directly from the Primadax page.
  2. Enter the Deposit Balance menu.
  3. To buy GICT, you need to have a balance at Primadax. If you already have a balance, skip this step. If you haven’t had a balance, please top up the balance in the following way:
    • Click ‘Deposit/Voucher’ in IDR or Rupiah Row.
    • Transfer the amount that you wish to deposit to 035-3119670, PT. TRIJAYA PRATAMA FUTURES, BCA.
    • Enter the name of the bank where you do the transfer, your Bank Account number, Deposit Amount, and Screenshot/Photo of transfer token.
    • Click Deposit.
    • Wait for the confirmation call.
  4. After your balance has been deposited, go back to the previous menu, then click ‘Market’ on the GICT Row.
  5. There are 2 purchasing features that you can use, Limit Order and Market Order. A Limit Order is a purchase at a price that is not on the order list (selling GICT), and a Market Order is a purchase at the lowest price on the order list (selling GICT).
    • Purchase Using a Limit Order:
    • Enter the Limit Order Tab.
    • Write the price you want.
    • Write the number of GICT that you want to buy.
    • Click Next.
    • Enter the Market Order Tab.
    • Write down how much IDR you want to deposit as GICT.
    • Click Next.
GICT purchases at the price in the order list will be charged a taker fee of 0.25%.

item16.title: How do I withdraw my GICT?
item16.content:
Make sure your GICT funds are stored in the wallet exchange and not in your trading/market maker account or portal.
  1. Access the Primadax Trading Platform. You can access through the user’s portal or directly from the Primadax page.
  2. Enter the Deposit Balance menu.
  3. Enter ‘Market’ on the GICT Row.
  4. There are 2 selling features that you can use, Limit Order and Market Order. Limit Orders are selling at prices that are not on the order list (buying GICT), and Market Orders are selling at the highest price on the order list (buying GICT).
    Selling using a Limit Order:
    • Enter the Limit Order Tab.
    • Write the price you desire.
    • Write down the number of GICTs that you want to sell.
    • Click Next.
    • Selling using Market Orders:
    • Enter the Market Order Tab.
    • Write down GICTs you want to sell.
    • Click Next.
  5. After the selling is successful and IDR funds have been obtained, enter the ‘Withdraw Balance’ menu then ‘IDR’.
  6. Then Fill in the Bank name, the city of the Bank, Bank Account Number, and the Amount of IDR that you want to withdraw.
GICT selling with prices in the order list will be charged a taker fee of 0.25%.

item17.title: How long does my withdrawal take?
item17.content:
The entire withdrawal process is carried out on weekdays. How long the withdrawal process depends on when it is carried out:
  • If done before 11 a.m (Jakarta Time): it will be processed on the same day.
  • If done after 11 a.m (Jakarta Time): it will be processed the next day.
This process is carried out for BCA Bank. For other banks, it will be received by the investors a few days later according to the procedures of each bank.

item18.title: How to make a deposit with Duitku Merchant?
item18.content:
How to deposit with Merchants Duitku on the GICTrade Portal?
  1. Complete the OTP and KYC verification process.
  2. Choose the “duitku” deposit method.
  3. Select the available transfer method and enter the transfer amount, click “Apply”.
  4. The process will be continued according to the selected merchant.
  5. After the payment process at the merchant is successful, your funds have charged the balance.


How to Deposit with Duitku at Primadax:
  1. Select the deposit balance menu and click deposit/voucher IDR/
  2. Select the ‘Duitku’ deposit option for IDR.
  3. Select the payment method available and write down the deposit amount for a minimum of 20,000 rupiahs, click Submit.
  4. The process will be continued according to the selected payment method.
After the payment process is successful, your funds have charged the balance.

item19.title: How do I register for GIC Trade?
item19.content:
Here is how to register for GIC Trade.
  1. Click Register.
  2. Fill in your personal data in accordance with the fields.
  3. Click the Register button.
  4. Check your email for activation link’ will appear then.
  5. Check your email for an email subject ‘GIC Trade Account Confirmation
  6. Click ‘Account Activation’.
Congratulations! You have successfully registered your data on the GICTrade website. To complete your data, you can complete your profile as soon as possible.

item20.title: How do I get The Activation Email again?
item20.content: To request a GIC account activation email, all you have to do is access the GICTrade login page. Write down your email and password you used when registering. Then, a message “your account has not been activated” will pop up. Please check the incoming message or click ‘here’ to resend the activation email. Please click on the word “here” and you will get your activation email in your inbox.

item21.title: Why have you Installed SL or TP on the Price Screen appear to have touched the price requested, but not DONE?
item21.content:
It is necessary to know in advance that the SL or TP which is considered "DONE" must meet the following conditions:
  1. Stoploss and Takeprofit levels are considered “DONE” if the Bid/Ask price on GICtrade Metatrader has touched the desired price, unless the price is categorized as “Wrong Quote”
  2. “Wrong Quote” or Quotation Error is: a condition where the available selling price (Bid) or the available buying price (Ask) displayed on MetaTrader 4 or 5 Client Terminal does not reflect the available selling price (Bid) or the available buying price (Ask)/ actual market conditions.
    • The price moves abnormally / wildly (up / down) and quickly from the last price and back again to the previous initial price. The price that occurs in the transaction does not match the market price at that time with reference to the price source in GICTrade.
    • The SL or TP price level that is done is not always done at the posted price, due to the fast movement in the high / "hightick" market.
    • Prices listed on Reuters, Telequote, Bridge and other Data Providers are only non-binding reference prices. Confirmation of "done" or "not done" of SL / TP is based on the Bid / Ask price in the GICTrade Meta trader.
  3. If there is a "Wrong Quote" in the system, then GICTrade has the right to cancel transactions that occur with or without customer approval.
  4. If there is an unreasonable widening of the spread in the market, the normal spread is: 60 points for Major Rate, 120 points for Cross Rate while for Gold is 100 points.

item22.title: Why can Pending Orders (LO = Limit Order and SO = Stop Order) or SL/TP disappear by themselves?
item22.content:
The following are things that must be considered to install LO / SO & SL / TP, namely:
  1. All LO / SOs can be placed 15 minutes after market opening on Monday. GICTrade can delete LO / SO placed less than 15 minutes after market opening without further notice.
  2. Trading hours for forex and Gold:
    • Forex Major Rate / Cross Rate:
      Summer :
      Monday = 06:01 - 03:59 WIB
      Tuesday - Thursday = 04:01 - 03:59 WIB
      Friday = 04:01 - 03:30 WIB
      Winter: Monday = 06:01 - 04:59 WIB
      Tuesday - Thursday = 05:01 - 04:59 WIB
      Friday = 05:01 - 04:30 WIB
    • Gold :
      Summer:
      Monday = 06:01 - 03:29 WIB
      Tuesday - Friday = 05:01 - 03:29
      Winter:
      Monday = 06:01 - 04:29 WIB
      Tuesday - Friday; at = 05:01 - 04:29
  3. Installed LO / SO & SL / TP will be valid until Friday. LO / SO that have not been done and have not been canceled / canceled on Friday will be canceled by GICTrade without prior notification.
  4. If there is a market holiday or there is an early market closure, the LO / SO & SL / TP that have been installed and have not been done will be deleted, and LO / SO & SL / TP can be re-installed 15 minutes after opening, the market the next day.
  5. If there is a market holiday before the market close on Friday, and at the time of closing the market holiday, the LO / SO has not been done and has not been canceled, then the LO / SO will be automatically canceled without further notification. Customer can re-install the LO / SO on the next day. .
    LO / SO installation can be used for new positions or liquidation.
